name: Mount Everest
description: The highest mountain in the world, located on the Nepal–China border. Represents the ultimate climbing achievement.

name: Kanchenjunga
description: The third highest mountain in the world, located between Nepal and India, considered sacred.

name: Lhotse
description: Fourth highest peak in the world, part of the Everest massif and a technical climbing favorite.

name: Makalu
description: Fifth highest mountain, known for its dramatic pyramid shape and extreme climbing routes.

name: Cho Oyu
description: Sixth highest peak, popular among climbers preparing for Everest due to its relatively moderate routes.

name: Dhaulagiri I
description: Seventh highest mountain in the world, located in western Nepal with vast snow fields.

name: Manaslu
description: Eighth highest mountain, offering scenic treks on the Manaslu Circuit route.

name: Annapurna I
description: Tenth highest peak and landmark of the Annapurna region, known for dramatic ridges.

name: Gyachung Kang
description: Fifteenth highest mountain in the world, located between Everest and Cho Oyu.

name: Annapurna II
description: Second major peak of the Annapurna range, a challenging climb with steep ridges.

name: Annapurna III
description: Third major summit in the Annapurna region with rugged peaks.

name: Annapurna IV
description: Fourth major summit of the Annapurna range, near the dramatic Annapurna sanctuary.

name: Annapurna South
description: Southern peak of the Annapurna massif, known for spectacular views.

name: Baruntse
description: A beautiful peak near Everest, often combined with Ama Dablam expeditions.

name: Pumori
description: A striking pyramid peak near the Everest region often photographed from base camp.

name: Ngadi Chuli
description: Also known as Peak 29, one of the highest unclimbed peaks for many years.

name: Chamlang
description: A Himalayan peak with steep faces, often climbed by advanced mountaineers.

name: Tilicho Peak
description: A famous trekking and climbing peak near Tilicho Lake, one of the highest lakes in the world.

name: Gauri Sankar
description: Twin‑peaked mountain named after the Hindu goddess Parvati (Gauri) and Shiva.

name: Ganesh Himal I
description: Part of the Ganesh Himal range west of Kathmandu, known for alpine landscapes.

name: Ama Dablam
description: One of Nepal’s most beautiful peaks, often called the ‘Matterhorn of the Himalayas.’

name: Mera Peak
description: The highest trekking peak in Nepal, offering panoramic views of Everest, Makalu and Kanchenjunga.

name: Island Peak
description: Popular trekking and climbing peak near Everest Base Camp.

name: Lobuche East
description: A well‑known trekking peak with views of Everest and the surrounding giants.

name: Cholatse
description: A striking peak in the Everest region loved by climbers for ice climbing routes.

name: Pisang Peak
description: A popular climb on the Annapurna circuit route with great views.

name: Hiunchuli
description: A peak connected to Annapurna South, known for its dramatic ridge line.

name: Kusum Kanguru
description: A Himalayan mountain with steep faces and ice routes, popular with technical climbers.

name: Kongde Ri
description: A Himalayan peak near Namche Bazaar with stunning vistas.

name: Pokalde
description: A scenic trekking peak in the Everest region with panoramic views.

name: Nirekha Peak
description: A popular peak with excellent views of Everest, Makalu and Kanchenjunga.

name: Khumbutse
description: Located near Everest, seen from base camp treks.

name: Taboche
description: A rugged peak near Cholatse and Ama Dablam in the Everest region.

name: Machapuchare (Fishtail)
description: A sacred peak near Annapurna Base Camp, closed to climbing due to spiritual reasons.

name: Yala Peak
description: A climbing peak in Langtang Valley known for its gentle slopes and views.

name: Nuptse
description: A neighbor of Everest, often seen from Everest Base Camp.

name: Khatung Kang
description: A technical peak near Makalu’s eastern shoulder.

name: Thapa Peak (Dhampus)
description: A scenic peak near Annapurna with panoramic landscapes.

name: Gangapurna
description: A sister peak of Annapurna in the Annapurna massif.

name: Kyazo Ri
description: A Himalayan peak near the Everest region with impressive views.

name: Phari Lapcha
description: A ridge peak on the Everest side with dramatic landscapes.

name: Dorje Lhakpa
description: A popular climbing peak in the Langtang region with snowy ridges.

name: Chamar
description: A remote peak in western Nepal near Dhaulagiri.

name: Gurja Himal
description: A steep and rugged peak in western Nepal.

name: Bhrikuti
description: A Himalayan peak in Nepal with alpine ridges.

name: Bhemadang RI
description: A peak near Annapurna region trekking routes.
